Rule: Higher education levels such as Bachelors, Doctorate, or Prof-school are associated with higher income (> 50k).
Occupations classified as 'Professional' or 'White-Collar' are associated with higher income (> 50k).
Working significantly more hours per week (e.g., 80 hours) can be associated with higher income (> 50k).
Achieving a Doctorate degree leads to a higher income.
Switching to a Professional occupation leads to higher income.
Being Male leads to a higher income.
Higher education levels (Masters, Doctorate, Bachelors) significantly increase the likelihood of earning more than $50k/year.
Being in a professional occupation increases the likelihood of earning more than $50k/year.
